ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Lauren Nicole Pincus  Lauren was fantastic, always helpful and super nice!

Instructor: Lauren Nicole Pincus  Lauren was cool, and helpful when asked. She perhaps could have offered more engagement with our groups during in class assignments, but overall she was very good and pleasant to work with.
Instructor: Lauren Nicole Pincus  Lauren is great.
Instructor: Mark Falinski  Mark Falinski.
Instructor: Mark Falinski  I worked most with Mark and Thomas.
Instructor: Mark Falinski  Mark was very supportive and generally very helpful. He was great, especially his help on Arduino related assignments.
Instructor: Mark Falinski  Mark was great.
Instructor: Mark Falinski  Mark Falinski

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Lauren Nicole Pincus  Thoughtful and helpful

Instructor: Lauren Nicole Pincus  Lauren was cool, and helpful when asked. She perhaps could have offered more engagement with our groups during in class assignments, but overall she was very good and pleasant to work with.
Instructor: Lauren Nicole Pincus  Lots of good guiding questions.
Instructor: Mark Falinski  He's great, so helpful and responsive to questions. We wouldn't have made it without him.
Instructor: Mark Falinski  Mark provided helpful guidance in class when working through final project design ideas. He could have been more accessible outside of class and during office hours.
Instructor: Mark Falinski  Very personable and helpful
Instructor: Mark Falinski  Amazing Arduino knowledge, great energy, approachable and always helpful

Instructor: Mark Falinski  Mark was very supportive and generally very helpful. He was great, especially his help on Arduino related assignments. Mark could have perhaps been more patient in his help to groups.
Instructor: Mark Falinski  Loved his enthusiasm.

Instructor: Mark Falinski  The TAs were given a lot of responsibility and we were basically only able to interact with them (instead of Julie and Paul) if this is going to be the case, the TAs should know a lot more than they do. Mark was great but it felt like we should be interacting with the professors a lot more.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I found the CEID staff to be particularly helpful when working on projects.

I suggest revising the schedule so that there is only 1 day for problem statements and 1 day for arduino. I suggest starting the projects earlier and suggest ditching the coffee cup challenge. Finally, have one class day to do all the trainings -- bring in the trainers and get all the certifications in one class time.
Julie and Paul make an amazing team, and their class reflects this. It was the most dynamic class I've ever taken, exposing us to new ideas and skills at a very rapid pace.

The instructors for the course are fun and energetic but they felt very absent from the course and I wish I could have learned more from them. They came, talked for 15 minutes and then let Thomas take over. When I had problems with certain issues, I wasn't able to approach the professors and had to go directly to one of the TAs who were not very helpful. I really wish the profs were more accessible and present in this course. It felt like we were not a very high priority. I wanted to comment on Thomas who was the other TA in the course. He basically ran the course so it's weird that there was no rating for him. I found him to be condescending and inflexible. When I would ask him questions, he would treat me like I was stupid and make me feel bad for asking the question instead of helping me understand the material. When I would approach him with requests or issues, he was completely inflexible and made things a lot harder than they needed to be. I felt uncomfortable working with him and am very disappointed with the way he ran the class. Paul and Julie need to take more of a present stand in the class and be available for the students instead of passing it on to Thomas because he is not approachable or helpful in most situations.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Hands-on approach to solving sustainable solutions.
The course was valuable to gain access to the CEID and practice using the design tools available to students.
Changing the way I think about a problem and how I tackle it

The evolution of the course and how it takes the students through the design process. I really enjoyed learning and experiencing the different phases from ideation, ethnography and prototyping (and everything in between). It was an amazing learning experience.

Definitely working with Julie and Paul. They made it fun and engaging and fascinating - and their instruction was terrific. But the concept of the course was also awesome - it really gave us as students the opportunity to push the boundaries and create new things - which was unparalleled in any other course I've taken.
3D printing
Hands on exercises

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Obviously time is tight, I understand that, and I'm not sure how to fix things without making it a two-semester (at least) course. Cut the midterm and add more time for both lectures and final project.

Some of the course requirements and processes seemed arbitrary and rushed, and the feedback provided by instructors was not always clear or helpful. Give more time to work on the final design project.
The final project needs more time, felt really cramped towards the end

It's hard to criticize this, since the course covered so many technologies and skills, but I did feel as though the tutorials on those various systems (onshape, makerbot etc) could have been more instructive and thorough. This is of course however in the context of the great ambition of the class to cover such a broad subject matter.

Too much in too little time. One project over the whole semester would have been better. You emphasize trying and failing and reiteration but there really isn't time for all of that unfortunately AND learning all the different programs. Wish I could have spent more time learning CAD and Arduino. Feel like I was introduced but none of it stuck.

We should focus on fewer things in more detail. The course tried to cover too much. Arduino could have been dropped in order to better understand CADfor instance or even to just help us work on our projects. Arduino was pretty unnecessary.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The lectures could be improved by adding more structure and guidance for facilitating the design process.
Good balance of lectures and working sessions.

Extremely well integrated and presented. One idea however to address question 18 would be to have optional sections with experts on the different software/tech for students that really want to excel at those skills.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course provides an overview for some of the quantitative skills learned in other classes (such as Life Cycle Assessment) and allows students to apply these concepts to a physical design project.
We should have more courses like this!
Seamlessly, I wanted to be given a space to create some new tech, and I got it in this class!!

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to improve my design skills and learn how to use the tools in the CEID.
To get an understanding of what goes into a sustainable design process and learn more about product design.
I wanted to be given a space to create some new tech, and I got it in this class!!
I like trying to design solutions
I wanted to work on my innovation skills and do some hands on exercises.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Absolutely.
The design knowledge and skills met my expectations, but the theory and instruction (particularly with LCA and Arduino) could be improved.
Yes! It was a great course
It exceeded my expectations actually, I have no background in engineering and was impressed with the Arduino and CAD stuff we learnt!
Yes mostly. I don't expect to become proficient in engineering overnight - but this did give me an entree and I now feel more equipped to pursue additional skills as needed. Great work!
Just an introduction really. Not deep enough.
mostly

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Only advantages. Group members all have different strengths, that's where the real learning comes in.

This class is entirely group work. If your group works well together and shares the workload evenly, it's great. But if someone doesn't pull their weight it makes the entire course much more difficult.

I appreciated the knowledge sharing and various skill sets that the group work consisted of. It was great to get experience working in teams of people with vastly different ways of approaching a problem.
At the end the team came together as one but there were definitely some challenges on the way. A lot of it came down to personalities clashing which I thought was an interesting conclusion.

The midterm could have been less intensive, which would have allowed for more time to complete the final projects. The group dynamics were at times great and at times trying - so while I think it is the best way to do the class, I think having the same groups throughout and allowing some student preference in group making might give greater cohesion to the teams created.
Advantages: learning my weaknesses Disadvantages: takes more time having to hash out everyone's ideas

Great to have different experiences. Groups worked much better when there was at least one engineer in the group because a lot of the work really needed to be done by an engineer or at least facilitated by someone who knows how to use CAD/other programs.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Be prepared to work through the projects with limited guidance, and leave plenty of time for creativity, failure, and revisions. Definitely reach out to CEID staff early on in your project.
Take it! It is hard work but so much fun!
Take it! This was the best class I've ever taken - I had so much fun and learned so much I can't recommend it more strongly.
Good to take if you are engineer
It's a fun course that will allow you to think differently but there's a lot of frustrating things about it and you will need to put in time.
